app.handlers.chats.chat_selection_loop(logged_user, db)[source]

Main loop allowing a user to browse and select chats.

Enables pagination, chat entry, and—if the user is the owner— access to chat management options.

Parameters:

  • logged_user (User) – The active user.

  • db (Database) – Database interface used when modifying chats.

app.handlers.chats.chat_viewer(logged_user, chat_info)[source]

Interactive chat viewer with live message reloading.

Runs a loop that refreshes chat messages on a timer while a background thread collects user input for sending messages or quitting.

Parameters:

  • logged_user (User) – User viewing the chat.

  • chat_info (dict) – Metadata for the selected chat.

app.handlers.chats.create_chat_in_xml(name, participants, owner_username)[source]

Create a chat entry inside the XML chats file.

Generates a new chat ID, assigns the owner, adds participants, and records the initial timestamp. Creates the XML structure if missing.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the chat.

  • participants (list[str]) – List of usernames participating in the chat.

  • owner_username (str) – Username of the chat owner.

Notes

  • The owner is always added as a participant if not already included.

  • The XML file is created if it does not exist.

app.handlers.chats.handle_create_chat(db, logged_user)[source]

Create a new chat and store it in the chats XML file.

Prompts the user for a chat name and participant selection, then creates the chat via create_chat_in_xml(). The logged user is always included as a participant.

Parameters:

  • db (Database) – Database interface used to fetch user information.

  • logged_user (User) – The user creating the chat.

Notes

  • Empty chat names are rejected.

  • Participant selection uses helper_select_users().

Returns:

(messages, latest_timestamp) where messages is a list of message dictionaries.

Return type:

tuple

app.handlers.chats.load_user_chats(logged_user)[source]

Load all chats the logged user participates in.

Reads the chats XML file and collects chat metadata for any chat where the user’s username appears in the participant list.

Parameters:

logged_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of chat dictionaries containing id, name, participants, and owner keys.

Return type:

list[dict]

app.handlers.chats.manage_chat(logged_user, chat_info, db)[source]

Manage chat settings and participants.

Only the chat owner may rename, modify membership, or delete the chat.

Parameters:

  • logged_user (User) – The user performing the action.

  • chat_info (dict) – Chat metadata structure.

  • db (Database) – Database interface used for user lookup.

app.handlers.chats.write_xml(tree, file_path='./vars/dev/chats.xml')[source]

Write an XML tree to file with indentation.

Supports both Python <3.9 (manual indentation) and Python ≥3.9 using xml.etree.ElementTree.indent().

Parameters:

  • tree (ElementTree) – Parsed XML tree to write.

  • file_path (str, optional) – Destination path for the XML file. Defaults to CHATS_FILE.
